intro: Lathyrus binatus, commonly known as the twin-flowered vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and it has a fibrous root system. Lathyrus binatus is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
